text: The church of San Ginés. San Ginés is a church in Arrecife, Lanzarote, Canary Islands, Spain. Originally the location of a hermitage built in 1574 that contained images of Saint Peter and Saint Ginés, it was flooded and completely rebuilt in 1667. It was expanded in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries.Iglesia De San Gines De Arrecife De Lanzarote Saint Ginés (Saint Genesius of Clermont) is Arrecife’s patron saint.Touring Lanzarote: Iglesia de San Ginés Mass is celebrated every evening, including Saturdays, Sundays and holydays, at 7.30 p.m. There are additional Masses at weekends and on feast days.Mass times in Lanzarote and La Graciosa The tower of the Church of San Ginés was inspired by the bell tower of the Church of La Concepción of Santa Cruz de Tenerife. == References == Gines, Arrecife Category:Catholic Church in the Canary Islands Category:Buildings and structures in Lanzarote Category:1574 establishments in Spain Category:Arrecife Category:Tourist attractions in Lanzarote
title: San Ginés, Arrecife
